FacilityName: Koch Nitrogen Company - Sergeant Bluff Terminal

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at your facility: The facility complies with
OSHAs 29 CFR 1910.111 requirements for anhydrous ammonia storage, and it is the facilitys policy to adhere
to applicable federal, state, and local laws. If an emergency were to occur, it is KNCs policy to notify
Woodbury County Fire Department or the Woodbury County Sheriffs Office.

A description of the facility and the regulated substances handled: The Koch Nitrogen Company, LLC -
Sergeant Bluff Ammonia Terminal stores anhydrous ammonia in and distributes it from one refrigerated
cylinder tank (60,000,000 pounds) and one 200 ton bullet tank (400,000 pounds). The total storage capacity
of anhydrous ammonia at the facility is 60,400,000 pounds.

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps: The facility
complies with the EPAs chemical accident prevention rule (40 CFR 68) and applicable state and local codes
and regulations. The anhydrous ammonia system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with
29 CFR 1910.111 and relevant American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) standards.

Five-year accident history: An accidental release of anhydrous ammonia resulting in death, injuries,
significant property damage, sheltering in place, or causing environmental damage on-site or off-site has not
occurred within the past five years.

The emergency response program: In the event of an emergency involving the anhydrous ammonia system, it
is the facilitys policy to notify the Woodbury County Emergency Management Agency and request that they
respond to the emergency. The facility has discussed this policy with the Local Emergency Planning
Committee (LEPC).

Planned changes to improve safety: None identified at this time.
